tweets.text: @MFRFurness @TM_WRT @agricontract @JamesAgscope @EnvAgency I live and work on those floodplains and I feel that widescale dredging is anything but helpful, it just floods us out faster

Unloading after over a week on the road battling the rain and snow. @SonTekYSI M9 & @ARCboat have collected some record data that helped issue @EnvAgencyMids flood warnings & will improve @FloodForecasts for next time #teamEA @DefraGovUK https://t.co/jG3ltcSCfZ
@MBAAssociates @agricontract @EnvAgency Is a watercourse silting up and restricting flow an alteration?  Is cleaning a watercourse and removing restrictions and foreign bodies an alteration?

Im sick of flooding can the @EnvAgency please look at what the Dutch to control rain fall remember you used to be called the National rivers authority üò°
#ollyblogs #LockdownLearning  #OllyRants #flooding #farming https://t.co/109bZBoZ6S

We have received a lot of feedback from residents on the flood warning from last week. Although I will get back to people individually I wanted to say that we have begun feeding back resident‚Äôs comments and have requested a meeting with @EnvAgency #Didsbury

@LeanLeft_Wright @CllrMajid @Diane4HodgeHill @BhamCityCouncil @BCC_Help @EnvAgency @shardcommunity Hi Paul.  The river debris is a matter for the Environment Agency and I'm taking this up with them.  There are also plans underway for wider renewal of the Cole Valley corridor which I'll keep you posted on.  You're right - it's a vital green asset for the whole community!

tweets.text: I have met with the @EnvAgency to discuss this week's flooding and the situation facing SY. I highlighted local concerns raised by residents of Low Valley and we discussed the regional and national challenges of flooding facing many parts of the country. https://t.co/AiXPtmIfz8

@agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Why are the water channels accumulating silt in the first place? Is it because they have been channeled to run straight and no longer carry sediments without settling, (Victor Schauberger) or that too much sediment is coming from erosion? Or both?

Last week, heavy rainfall from #StormChristoph caused #flooding across England.

Our staff have been working around the clock to keep the public and their homes safe.

There are still #FloodWarnings in place, so check your local flood risk now: https://t.co/X4IQl2YjjH https://t.co/YWbK4V6l3t

@EnvAgencyAnglia If this is farmer making amends for the pollution then it‚Äôs clearly not working & allowing the pigs to stay until weather conditions improve will inevitably allow pollution to continueü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èwhere will the üêñbe moved to ?

SuDS is included in the Geography curriculum so they can be a useful educational resource. This monitoring can be used by the pupils of @CarshaltonHigh to learn more about how rain planters can help slow the flow of water into our drains #SuDSnotFloods @EnvAgencySE @Sudsulike https://t.co/s4X2q1q47I

urls.description: At last we‚Äôre in 2021 and here‚Äôs hoping that it‚Äôs much better than 2020 - although that doesn‚Äôt set a very high bar. Christmas was different this year and Hogmanay was unrecognisably quiet, especially for a Scot. One good outcome ‚Ä¶

tweets.text: Flow monitoring has just been installed on two of the rain planters @CarshaltonHigh. This will improve understanding of how the planters are storing and slowing down the flow of water to reduce flood risk, and allow us to improve our future designs. #SuDSnotFloods @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/eE0EVxI3Cn

River levels remain high across the #Midlands especially on the #Severn & #Trent. Many #flood warnings & alerts remain in place please check your #flood risk.
https://t.co/HbkZ4AAIDL https://t.co/HiW6LYEqRi

@Rosewood_Farm @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency The dutch changed their tact in 2001, now a big focus on 1. Retention of excess rainfall in the soil. 2. Storage of excess water in the field or local area. 3. Controlled removal. Intensifying field drainage only further lowers the level exponentially.

A blog from the @EnvAgency about how they are consulting on their preliminary conclusions regarding the #GDA:

https://t.co/OtdO2WCSdi

#EA #GDA #NetZero #nuclear

@EnvAgencyAnglia You are correct the fst photo is from earlier as it shows that the pig farmer has filled the ditch in with liquid mud & this hasn‚Äôt prevented the runoff as all it has done is to divert it across the footpath & into the stream 1 photo the Cong 21 Jan & the other 3 23 Jan https://t.co/b1gJm9gaLr

@billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency Arable, yes, but come the summer Olly will be moaning about drought - rather than wicking it out to sea as quickly as possible I think we should be keeping more fresh water on the farm where it's needed. It's not rewilding so much as refarming, treating our resources wisely.

(1/3) We are aware of the issue of run-off from this pig unit entering water courses during heavy downpours. However, the picture shared below was from December, not 23 January 2021.  Since these pictures were taken, the farmer has taken actions to prevent further run off into.. https://t.co/rcYFyowElj

tweets.text: @agricontract @EnvAgency Most rivers are tidal at the bottom. High tide plus an entire catchments worth of water moved to the bottom could be disastrous.  All the rainfall rather than be spread across an entire catchment is then moved to one place.

tweets.text:
@agricontract @MFRFurness @EnvAgency An idiots guide indeed. That was a horribly ignorant account of catchment hydrology. The explanation of reducing flood risk & soil dynamics as well is 1dimension & wholly unrealistic. 

Try looking up Catchment Sensitive Farming and Natural Flood Management from your national EPA

tweets.text:
While we wait to hear plans from the #RiverSevernPartnership and @EnvAgency
 on a long term solution for River Severn flooding, it is important we now focus on short term measures to alleviate the severe flooding we have seen in the past couple of weeks.

https://t.co/Uzvz20qVTI

@agricontract @JamesAgscope @EnvAgency Unfortunately it isn't as simple as that. Dredging has a wide range of negative impacts on rivers and the environment - it is also totally unsustainable. A network of connected floodplains is a far better option for a wide range of reasons. Dissipate energy, dont concentrate it.
@thisfarmlife @agricontract @EnvAgency Any alterations to someone's property that affect the drainage of those downhill are the liability of the person carrying out the alterations
@agricontract @EnvAgency A dredged river moves water faster. Which is great except for the people downstream.  It needs planning on a catchment scale, with areas of flood storage planned out.

@DKShrewsbury @EnvAgency Please can you allow comments on all your tweets? First one in over a year and you're supposed to be a democratically accountable MP.
https://t.co/kuKLf0lQlK

urls.title: COVID-19 -an open letter from Shrewsbury Labour Party to Daniel Kawczynski MP and the UK government - Shrewsbury Labour
urls.description: In times of global and national crisis those in government must be open to scrutiny and held to account by Parliament, the media, the public, and opposition parties. This collaborative approach of checks and balances is also fundamental to our democracy. As we progress through the coronavirus pandemic, we are shocked to note a deterioration in public access to politicians, including yourself. We therefore ask you to respect the democratic process of scrutiny by¬† responding to emails, agreeing to be‚Ä¶

tweets.text: @agricontract @EnvAgency Completely agree, the environmentalists (arm chair theorists) will never look for solutions just blame. Look at the farmer who was slated for dredging a stretch of river that kept flooding. He solved the problem not the EA
@powell_peter @EnvAgency Start down stream simple

Our staff are out & about in the #Midlands using technology to help measure the flow of #flood water like here on the #Trent in #Notts where a remote controlled boat provides data.
There are still alerts & warnings in place ‚Äì check your #flood risk
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/hDrqeynuCR

tweets.text: @agricontract @EnvAgency Is it not common law that water from higher land has to be allowed free, uninterrupted passage to the lower ground?  Failure of @EnvAgency to maintain rivers or allow maintenance is surly making them liable?

@SE_Rivers_Trust @EnvAgencySE @CarshaltonHigh @Sudsulike @Thames_RvrsTrst The Caterham Flood Action Group would be very interested in discussing similar options in our catchment, please could you help?

@farmers_against @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @GeorgeMonbiot @CraigBennett3 What are your qualifications in catchment hydrology, hydraulics and soil dynamics? If you're going to use 'armchair experts' you better backup your own credentials. This sort of thing is why the divide between the farming community and the public is getting larger

Our National Flood and Coastal Erosion Risk Management Strategy for England is a key step towards making sure our country is more resilient to flooding and coastal change.
